TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in FAC ( Savoie ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE she signed a notarial deed by which she entered into a leasing arrangement with a limited company called NORP for the renovation and furnishment of a holiday centre . She intended to run the business as a sole trader . As early as DATE she complained that the company had failed to complete the renovation works stipulated in the contract .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a criminal complaint against the company for fraud , theft and fraudulent breach of trust and sought leave to join the proceedings as a civil party seeking damages .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigating judge discontinued the proceedings in an order worded as follows :

“ It appears , in fact , from the evidence given by the civil parties and the head of PERSON and from the documents produced by the parties that the leasing arrangement , the mechanism of which has been described as fraudulent by the civil party , does not fall within the ambit of the criminal law . The disputes between [ the applicant ] and PERSON are clearly matters governed by civil or commercial law and have , moreover , given rise to various proceedings of this type in the civil or commercial courts . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against that order .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG upheld the order in question . It found that the applicant 's complaints were “ manifestly dilatory ” and that some of her allegations were “ contradictory ” , “ purely gratuitous ” or “ entirely unsupported ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed to ORG . Her appeal was heard on DATE . She was represented by counsel . Both parts of the reporting judge 's report ( the first containing a statement of the facts , the procedure and the grounds of appeal and the second a legal analysis of the case and an opinion on the merits of the appeal ) had been sent to the advocate - general prior to the hearing . However , the applicant had not been sent a copy of both parts of the reporting judge 's report . In a judgment of the same date ORG declared the appeal inadmissible on the following grounds :

“ ORG is satisfied from the wording of the judgment appealed against that , in upholding the order discontinuing the proceedings , ORG , after examining all the facts alleged by the appellant and addressing the main arguments in her memorial , stated the reasons for its decision that there was insufficient evidence that anyone had committed the alleged offences of fraudulent breach of trust and fraud or any other offence .

None of the grounds of appeal , which amount to contesting the validity of the judges ' findings of fact and of law , corresponds to any of the situations in which a civil party may appeal to ORG , under LAW , against a judgment of an indictment division in the absence of an appeal by the prosecution ... ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure provides :
“ A civil party can not appeal to ORG against judgments of the investigation division unless the prosecution lodges an appeal .
However , an appeal to ORG by the civil party alone shall be admissible in the following circumstances :
( CARDINAL ) where the investigation division has stated in the judgment that there are no grounds for an investigation ;
( CARDINAL ) where the investigation division has declared the civil party 's action inadmissible ;
( CARDINAL ) where the investigation division has upheld an objection terminating the criminal proceedings ;
( CARDINAL ) where the investigation division has declared , of its own motion , or on an objection by the parties , that it has no jurisdiction ;
( CARDINAL ) where the investigation division has omitted to rule on a charge ;
( CARDINAL ) where the judgment does not formally satisfy the conditions essential for its legal validity ;
( CARDINAL ) where a breach of personal rights as defined in Articles CARDINAL - CARDINAL to CARDINAL - CARDINAL and CARDINAL to CARDINAL of LAW has been alleged . ”

CARDINAL . ORG has confirmed that Article CARDINAL is compatible with LAW . In a recent judgment ORG reiterated that there was no incompatibility between the CARDINAL foregoing provisions , “ since the victim had a remedy in the civil courts by which to exercise his or her rights ” ( Court of Cassation , Criminal Division ( GPE . crim . ) , DATE , PERSON , ORG . crim . ) no . CARDINAL ) .
